com.clearent.idtech.android.family.device

Interface VP3300

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VP3300Impl

    public interface VP3300
    This interface describes the common interactions with a VP3300 card reader.

    • Method Summary

      Start Device Transaction Request - Authorizes the MSR (or CTLS) or EMV transaction for an ICC card This method let's you start a transaction but just in case you lose a bluetooth connection you can pass in the same variables as the registerListen(int,int) method to attempt reconnects.

    • Method Detail

      • device_configurePeripheralAndConnect

        void device_configurePeripheralAndConnect()
        This method will set up the device with the best peripheral configuration (ex- audio jack baud rate) and then connect the device. It will call the Clearent backend to get a configuration. If it isn't found, and an IDTech formatted xml file is provided in the ApplicationContext, it will attempt to configure using the Xml file provided. To avoid thread issues (asking the reader to do something while it's busy doing something else) call this method after the isReady() callback is done.

      • device_connect

        boolean device_connect()
        This is used to connect to the device. the device.

      • registerListen

        void registerListen()
        This method will register a listener to start working with the device (initiates a connection). For Bluetooth, the method will monitor the IDTech framework's GATT callback and if a connection is not established will wait and retry based on defaults : DEFAULT_DELAY_IN_MILLISECONDS_BETWEEN_REGISTERLISTEN_RETRIES = 500; DEFAULT_NUMBER_OF_REGISTERLISTEN_RETRIES = 4; (Retries do not apply to audio jack readers)

      • unregisterListen

        void unregisterListen()
        This method will unregister a listener.

      • device_setDeviceType

        boolean device_setDeviceType(com.idtechproducts.device.ReaderInfo.DEVICE_TYPE deviceType)
        Set the device type and does a couple of checks related to the connection and registration state. Device Types DEVICE_TYPE.DEVICE_VP3300_AJ, DEVICE_TYPE.DEVICE_VP3300_AJ_USB, DEVICE_TYPE.DEVICE_VP3300_USB, DEVICE_TYPE.DEVICE_VP3300_BT, DEVICE_TYPE.DEVICE_VP3300_BT_USB
        Parameters:
        deviceType - ReaderInfo.DEVICE_TYPE
        Returns:
        if false is returned there is an issue with the registration/connection. Probably should prompt user to connect/reconnect device.

        Returns:
        ReaderInfo.DEVICE_TYPE

        Get the version of SDK.

      • emv_callbackResponsePIN

        int emv_callbackResponsePIN(int mode,
                            byte[] KSN,
                            byte[] PIN)
        Callback Response PIN Request Provides PIN data to the kernel after a callback was received pinRequest delegate.
        Parameters:
        mode - PIN Mode: EMV_PIN_MODE_CANCEL = 0X00, EMV_PIN_MODE_ONLINE_PIN_DUKPT = 0X01, EMV_PIN_MODE_ONLINE_PIN_MKSK = 0X02, EMV_PIN_MODE_OFFLINE_PIN = 0X03
        KSN - Key Serial Number. If no pairing and PIN is plaintext, value is nil
        PIN - PIN data, encrypted. If no pairing, PIN will be sent plaintext
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • device_isConnected

        boolean device_isConnected()
        get the status if the device connected.
        Returns:
        true or false

      • device_startTransaction

        int device_startTransaction(double amount,
                            double amtOther,
                            int type,
                            int timeout,
                            byte[] tags)
        Start Device Transaction Request - Authorizes the MSR (or CTLS) or EMV transaction for an ICC card
        Parameters:
        amount - Transaction amount value (tag value 9F02)
        amtOther - Other amount value, if any (tag value 9F03)
        type - Transaction type (tag value 9C).
        timeout - Timeout value in seconds.
        tags - Any other tags to be included in the request. Passed as a string. Example, tag 9F0C with amount 0x000000000100 would be "9F0C06000000000100" If tags 9F02 (amount),9F03 (other amount), or 9C (transaction type) are included, they will take priority over these values supplied as individual parameters to this method. Note: To request tags to be included in default response, use tag DFEE1A, and specify tag list. Example four tags 9F02, 9F36, 95, 9F37 to be included in response = DFEE1A079F029F369f9F37
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • device_cancelTransaction

        int device_cancelTransaction()
        Cancels the currently executing Device transaction
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • device_getFirmwareVersion

        int device_getFirmwareVersion(StringBuilder version)
        Gets the firmware version
        Parameters:
        version - StringBuilder containing the firmware version
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • device_pingDevice

        int device_pingDevice()
        Pings the reader. If connected, returns success. Otherwise, returns timeout.
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • device_sendDataCommand

        int device_sendDataCommand(String cmd,
                           boolean calcLRC,
                           String data,
                           com.idtechproducts.device.ResDataStruct respData)
        Sends a Direct Command Sends a NEO IDG ViVOtech 2.0 command
        Parameters:
        cmd - Two bytes command (including subCommand) as per NEO IDG Reference Guide (UniPayIII)
        calcLRC - Not used for IDG devices
        data - Command data (if applicable) for IDG devices
        respData - Returns response ResDataStruct.resData. Status Code in ResDataStruct.statusCode
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • device_sendDataCommand

        int device_sendDataCommand(String cmd,
                           boolean calcLRC,
                           String data,
                           com.idtechproducts.device.ResDataStruct respData,
                           int timeout)
        Sends a Direct Command Sends a NEO IDG ViVOtech 2.0 command
        Parameters:
        cmd - Two bytes command (including subCommand) as per NEO IDG Reference Guide (UniPayIII)
        calcLRC - Not used for IDG devices
        data - Command data (if applicable) for IDG devices
        respData - Returns response ResDataStruct.resData. Status Code in ResDataStruct.statusCode
        timeout - Command timeout
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

        mode 0 = OFF, 1 = Always On, 2 = Auto Exit
        Parameters:
        mode - burst mode
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • icc_getICCReaderStatus

        int icc_getICCReaderStatus(com.idtechproducts.device.ICCReaderStatusStruct ICCStatus)
        Pointer that will return with the ICCReaderStatus results. bit 0: 0 = ICC Power Not Ready, 1 = ICC Powered bit 1: 0 = Card not seated, 1 = card seated
        Parameters:
        ICCStatus - icc status
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • icc_powerOnICC

        int icc_powerOnICC(com.idtechproducts.device.ResDataStruct atrPPS)
        Power up the currently selected microprocessor card in the ICC reader. It follows the ISO7816-3 power up sequence and returns the ATR as its response.
        Parameters:
        atrPPS - please see PowerOnStructure class for more information.
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • icc_passthroughOnICC

        int icc_passthroughOnICC()
        Enables pass through mode for ICC. Required when direct ICC commands are required (power on/off ICC, exchange APDU)
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • icc_passthroughOffICC

        int icc_passthroughOffICC()
        Disables pass through mode for ICC. Required when executing transactions (start EMV, start MSR, authenticate transaction)
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • icc_powerOffICC

        int icc_powerOffICC(com.idtechproducts.device.ResDataStruct respData)
        Powers down the ICC
        Parameters:
        respData - response data
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • emv_startTransaction

        int emv_startTransaction(double amount,
                         double amtOther,
                         int type,
                         int timeout,
                         byte[] tags,
                         boolean forceOnline)
        Start EMV Transaction Request
        Parameters:
        amount - Transaction amount value (tag value 9F02)
        amtOther - Other amount value, if any (tag value 9F03)
        type - Transaction type (tag value 9C).
        timeout - Timeout value in seconds.
        tags - Any other tags to be included in the request. Passed as a string. Example, tag 9F0C with amount 0x000000000100 would be "9F0C06000000000100" If tags 9F02 (amount),9F03 (other amount), or 9C (transaction type) are included, they will take priority over these values supplied as individual parameters to this method.
        forceOnline - TRUE = do not allow offline approval, FALSE = allow ICC to approve offline if terminal capable Note: To request tags to be included in default response, use tag DFEE1A, and specify tag list. Example four tags 9F02, 9F36, 95, 9F37 to be included in response = DFEE1A079F029F369f9F37
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • emv_cancelTransaction

        int emv_cancelTransaction(com.idtechproducts.device.ResDataStruct respData)
        Cancels the currently executing EMV transaction.
        Parameters:
        respData - response data
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • emv_lcdControlResponse

        void emv_lcdControlResponse(byte mode,
                            byte data)
        Callback Response LCD Display Provides menu selection responses to the kernel after a callback was received lcdDisplay delegate.
        Parameters:
        mode - lcd mode The choices are as follows 0x00 Cancel 0x01 Menu Display 0x02 Normal Display get Function Key supply either 0x43 ('C') for Cancel, or 0x45 ('E') for Enter/accept 0x08 Language Menu Display
        data - Line number in hex (0x01, 0x02), or 'C'/'E' of function key

      • emv_completeTransaction

        int emv_completeTransaction(boolean commError,
                            byte[] authCode,
                            byte[] iad,
                            byte[] tlvScripts,
                            byte[] tags)
        Complete EMV Transaction Request
        Parameters:
        commError - Communication error with host. Set to TRUE if host was unreachable, or FALSE if host response received. If Communication error, authCode, iad, tlvScripts can be null.
        authCode - Authorization code from host. Two bytes. Example 0x3030. (Tag value 8A). Required
        iad - Issuer Authentication Data, if any. Example 0x11223344556677883030 (tag value 91).
        tlvScripts - 71/72 scripts, if any
        tags - Additional TVL data to return with transaction results (if any)
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • msr_cancelMSRSwipe

        int msr_cancelMSRSwipe()
        Cancels MSR swipe request.
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • msr_startMSRSwipe

        int msr_startMSRSwipe()
        Enable MSR swipe card. Returns encrypted MSR data or function key value by call back function. The function swipeMSRData in interface
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • msr_startMSRSwipe

        int msr_startMSRSwipe(int timeout)
        Enable MSR swipe card. Returns encrypted MSR data or function key value by call back function. The function swipeMSRData in interface
        Parameters:
        timeout - Swipe Timeout Value timeout value in seconds; maximum value is 255 seconds. If it is 0, it will be set to 5 seconds.
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • ctls_startTransaction

        int ctls_startTransaction(double amount,
                          double amtOther,
                          int type,
                          int timeout,
                          byte[] tags)
        Start CTLS (or MSR) Transaction Request
        Parameters:
        amount - Transaction amount value (tag value 9F02)
        amtOther - Other amount value, if any (tag value 9F03)
        type - Transaction type (tag value 9C).
        timeout - Timeout value in seconds.
        tags - Any other tags to be included in the request. Passed as a string. Example, tag 9F0C with amount 0x000000000100 would be "9F0C06000000000100" If tags 9F02 (amount),9F03 (other amount), or 9C (transaction type) are included, they will take priority over these values supplied as individual parameters to this method. Note: To request tags to be included in default response, use tag DFEE1A, and specify tag list. Example four tags 9F02, 9F36, 95, 9F37 to be included in response = DFEE1A079F029F369f9F37 For SmartTap, pass the tag FFEE08 with the value 0200 For Apple VAS, pass the tag FFEE06 with the value 9F220201009F2604000000009F2B050100000000DF010101
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • ctls_cancelTransaction

        int ctls_cancelTransaction()
        Cancels the currently executing CTLS transaction (or MSR swipe request).
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • release

        void release()
        This method resets the object back to a state where its no longer registered, connected, or aware of an android device configuration.

      • device_setPollMode

        int device_setPollMode(byte mode)
        1 - enable constant polling, 0 - disable polling and rely on pushing the button to initiate each transaction (default).
        Parameters:
        mode -
        Returns:

        void autoConfig_stop()

      • config_setXMLFileNameWithPath

        void config_setXMLFileNameWithPath(String path)
        Set the IDTech formatted xml file to set up the device with the peripheral configuration (ex- audio jack baud rate) Then call config_loadingConfigurationXMLFile.

      • config_loadingConfigurationXMLFile

        boolean config_loadingConfigurationXMLFile(boolean updateAutomatically)
        This method will set up the device with the peripheral configuration (ex- audio jack baud rate) based on an IDTech formatted xml file. To avoid thread issues (asking the reader to do something while it's busy doing something else) call this method after the isReady() callback is done.

      • device_connectWithProfile

        boolean device_connectWithProfile(com.idtechproducts.device.StructConfigParameters profile)
        Instead of using config_loadingConfigurationXMLFile or device_configurePeripheralAndConnect you can just configure directly by creating a profile manually. To avoid thread issues (asking the reader to do something while it's busy doing something else) call this method after the isReady() callback is done.

      • isReaderConfigured

        boolean isReaderConfigured()
        Call this method to see if the reader has been configured (example, applying the emv certified configuration). You should be able to rely on the isReady method in the listener but in case there is a need this method will tell you if the reader is configured.

      • isDeviceConfigured

        boolean isDeviceConfigured()
        Call this method when you want to see if the clearent peripheral configuration has completed (used with audio jack).

      • setAutoConfiguration

        void setAutoConfiguration(boolean enable)
        By default the Clearent framework will configure the reader based on an emv certification process Clearent went through. To disable this feature set the auto configuration to false. Do not disable unless you've been notified previously by the framework (isReady in the listener was called successfully) that a configuration was applied successfully. Note: Configuration can take time (up to 2 minutes).
        Parameters:
        enable -

      • applyClearentConfiguration

        void applyClearentConfiguration()
        If auto configuration has been disabled and you want to control when the Clearent configuration is applied to the reader use this method.

      • setReaderConfiguredSharedPreference

        void setReaderConfiguredSharedPreference(boolean flag)
        A SharedPreference is used to disable any further reader configuration once the framework determines a successful configuration. If you want the reader configuration to be applied again call this method with false.
        Parameters:
        flag -

      • getStoredDeviceSerialNumberOfConfiguredReader

        String getStoredDeviceSerialNumberOfConfiguredReader()
        A SharedPreference is used to to store the device serial number of the reader that was configured.
        Returns:
        if found return it otherwise returns all Nines.

        Used to update the firmware.
        Parameters:
        fwTool -

      • registerListen

        void registerListen(int reconnectBluetoothNumberOfRetries,
                    int reconnectBluetoothDelayInMillisecondsBetweenRetries)
        After scanning for a bluetooth device, you can use this method instead of the no arg registerListen method to manage bluetooth reconnects. The method will monitor the IDTech framework's GATT callback and if a connection is not established will wait and retry based on the reconnectBluetoothDelayInMillisecondsBetweenRetries. (Retries do not apply to audio jack readers)
        Parameters:
        reconnectBluetoothNumberOfRetries - - Used to reconnect the bluetooth reader
        reconnectBluetoothDelayInMillisecondsBetweenRetries - - Used to reconnect the bluetooth reader

      • device_startTransaction

        int device_startTransaction(double amount,
                            double amtOther,
                            int type,
                            int timeout,
                            byte[] tags,
                            int reconnectBluetoothNumberOfRetries,
                            int reconnectBluetoothDelayInMillisecondsBetweenRetries)
        Start Device Transaction Request - Authorizes the MSR (or CTLS) or EMV transaction for an ICC card This method let's you start a transaction but just in case you lose a bluetooth connection you can pass in the same variables as the registerListen(int,int) method to attempt reconnects.
        Parameters:
        amount - Transaction amount value (tag value 9F02)
        amtOther - Other amount value, if any (tag value 9F03)
        type - Transaction type (tag value 9C).
        timeout - Timeout value in seconds.
        tags - Any other tags to be included in the request. Passed as a string. Example, tag 9F0C with amount 0x000000000100 would be "9F0C06000000000100" If tags 9F02 (amount),9F03 (other amount), or 9C (transaction type) are included, they will take priority over these values supplied as individual parameters to this method. Note: To request tags to be included in default response, use tag DFEE1A, and specify tag list. Example four tags 9F02, 9F36, 95, 9F37 to be included in response = DFEE1A079F029F369f9F37
        reconnectBluetoothNumberOfRetries - - Used to reconnect the bluetooth reader
        reconnectBluetoothDelayInMillisecondsBetweenRetries - - Used to reconnect the bluetooth reader
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString

      • addRemoteLogRequest

        void addRemoteLogRequest(String clientSoftwareVersion,
                         String message)
        The Clearent solution includes remote logging to aid in support calls. If you want to contribute to these logs pass us some identification, preferably the name and version of your solution, and a brief log message.
        Parameters:
        clientSoftwareVersion -
        message -

      • emv_startTransaction

        int emv_startTransaction(double amount,
                         double amtOther,
                         int type,
                         int timeout,
                         byte[] tags,
                         boolean forceOnline,
                         int reconnectBluetoothNumberOfRetries,
                         int reconnectBluetoothDelayInMillisecondsBetweenRetries)
        Start EMV Transaction Request
        Parameters:
        amount - Transaction amount value (tag value 9F02)
        amtOther - Other amount value, if any (tag value 9F03)
        type - Transaction type (tag value 9C).
        timeout - Timeout value in seconds.
        tags - Any other tags to be included in the request. Passed as a string. Example, tag 9F0C with amount 0x000000000100 would be "9F0C06000000000100" If tags 9F02 (amount),9F03 (other amount), or 9C (transaction type) are included, they will take priority over these values supplied as individual parameters to this method.
        forceOnline - TRUE = do not allow offline approval, FALSE = allow ICC to approve offline if terminal capable Note: To request tags to be included in default response, use tag DFEE1A, and specify tag list. Example four tags 9F02, 9F36, 95, 9F37 to be included in response = DFEE1A079F029F369f9F37
        reconnectBluetoothNumberOfRetries - - Used to reconnect the bluetooth reader
        reconnectBluetoothDelayInMillisecondsBetweenRetries - - Used to reconnect the bluetooth reader
        Returns:
        success or error code. Values can be parsed with device_getResponseCodeString
